required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maintaining Autonomy as we Age. Strategy Training for Age-related Executive Dysfunction.
clinical_study.official_title: Maintaining Autonomy as we Age: Investigating the Application of a Strategy Training Approach for Ameliorating the Effects of Age-related Executive Dysfunction - Part II

brief_summary.textblock: Healthy older adults with self-reported cognitive difficulties who receive strategy training will demonstrate greater performance benefits on measures of real-world activities, relative to those receiving a control intervention, immediately post treatment and at follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Goals Improved to Criterion on the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: COPM is a standardized semi-structure interview in which participants identify goals related to everyday life activities. Goals considered improved to criterion are those that had 2 or more points increase on COPM ratings.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: GSE is a self efficacy scale with a minimum score of 10 and a maximum score of 40. Higher scores indicate higher self efficacy

secondary_outcome.measure: Stanford Patient Education Research Center- General Health Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Stanford Patient Education Research Center has different measures of health related behaviors. General Health is one of the subscales. scores range 1-5 and higher score indicate better general health

secondary_outcome.measure: Stanford Patient Education Research Center- Health Distress Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Stanford Patient Education Research Center has different measures of health related behaviors. Health distress is one of the subscales. Scores range 0-20 and higher score indicates more distress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stanford Patient Education Research Center- Physical Activity Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Stanford Patient Education Research Center has different measures of health related behaviors. Physical activity is one of the subscales. Scores indicate number of hours of physical activity per week

secondary_outcome.measure: Stanford Patient Education Research Center- Communication With Physicians Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Stanford Patient Education Research Center has different measures of health related behaviors. communication with physicians is one of the subscales. Scores range 1-15 and higher score indicates more preparation for visits and greater ability to ask questions

secondary_outcome.measure: Stanford Patient Education Research Center- Visits to Physician and Emergency Department in the Past Six Months Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Stanford Patient Education Research Center has different measures of health related behaviors. Visits to physician and emergency department in the past six months subscale is one of the subscales.

secondary_outcome.measure: Delis Kaplan Executive Function System (DKEFS) Tower Test- Mean First-Move Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: This is a measure of executive function. The score reflects the average of the participant's first-move times, i.e. the time a participant took to make the first move

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: This is a measure of executive function. Total achievement scores indicate the highest score participants scored on the test. The lowest score possible is 0 and the highest score possible is 30. Higher scores indicate better performance.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: This is a measure of executive function where participants are given a letter and asked to generate as many words as they can think of within 60 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: DKEFS Trail Making- Condition 4: Number-letter Switching
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
secondary_outcome.description: DKEFS trail making condition 4 is a measure of executive function that requires the participant to switch back and forth between connecting numbers and letters in a sequence

intervention.description: The key features of the protocol are: i. Participants are actively engaged in selecting their treatment goals. The research clinician will work with the participants to identify five specific, measurable real-world goals using a standardized semi-structured interview, the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure. Three of these will be training goals, two will not be trained but evaluated post-intervention for evidence of generalization and transfer to non-trained tasks; ii. A global problem solving approach is used (Goal- Plan- Do- Check). Participants are guided by the trainer to apply this strategy to their goals.
intervention.other_name: Adopted Cognitive Orientation to Occupational Performance (CO-OP)

intervention.description: The active comparator uses an information-based format and is designed to engage participants without providing any specific training techniques or strategies. During weekly sessions, participants will receive factual information on brain structure and function, age-related cognitive changes, and general brain health issues and will spend time doing non-specific cognitive exercises including crossword and Sudoku puzzles. Homework will consist of reading assignments related to the session topics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All participants must score within 1.5 standard deviation (SD) of age and education-corrected normative data for the Montreal Cognitive Assessment and on a battery of neuropsychological tests of attention, memory and executive function (which will insure that participants are unlikely to meet the criteria for Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI)).
- No clinically relevant depression (scores â‰¤22) on the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
- Fluent in written and spoken English
- Self-reported complains about cognitive function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recent bereavement (within last 6 months)
- History of neurological disease
- Psychiatric illness requiring hospitalization and/or history or current substance abuse

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from a research subject pool and a community psycho-education program at Baycrest.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 96 participants were assessed for study eligibility. 60 participants were excluded after a phone screening interview and 17 were excluded after a more detailed baseline assessment which included cognitive paper and pencil tasks. The remaining 19 participants were randomized to either the experimental arm or the control arm.

group.title: Cogntive Training
group.description: Real world strategy approach: The key features of the protocol are: i. Participants are actively engaged in selecting their treatment goals. The research clinician will work with the participants to identify five specific, measurable real-world goals using a standardized semi-structured interview, the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure. Three of these will be training goals, two will not be trained but evaluated post-intervention for evidence of generalization and transfer to non-trained tasks; ii. A global problem solving approach is used (Goal- Plan- Do- Check). Participants are guided by the trainer to apply this strategy to their goals.

group.title: Psychosocial Education
group.description: The active comparator was an information-based format and is designed to engage participants without providing any specific training techniques or strategies. During weekly sessions, participants received factual information on brain structure and function, age-related cognitive changes, and general brain health issues and spent time doing non-specific cognitive exercises including crossword and Sudoku puzzles. Homework consisted of reading assignments related to the session topics.

group.title: Cognitive Training
group.description: Real world strategy approach: The key features of the protocol are: i. Participants are actively engaged in selecting their treatment goals. The research clinician will work with the participants to identify five specific, measurable real-world goals using a standardized semi-structured interview, the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure. Three of these will be training goals, two will not be trained but evaluated post-intervention for evidence of generalization and transfer to non-trained tasks; ii. A global problem solving approach is used (Goal- Plan- Do- Check). Participants are guided by the trainer to apply this strategy to their goals.

group.title: Psychosocial Education
group.description: The active comparator uses an information-based format and is designed to engage participants without providing any specific training techniques or strategies. During weekly sessions, participants will receive factual information on brain structure and function, age-related cognitive changes, and general brain health issues and will spend time doing non-specific cognitive exercises including crossword and Sudoku puzzles. Homework will consist of reading assignments related to the session topics.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Total Number of Goals Improved to Criterion on the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
outcome.description: COPM is a standardized semi-structure interview in which participants identify goals related to everyday life activities. Goals considered improved to criterion are those that had 2 or more points increase on COPM ratings.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately post intervention (2 months) and 3 months later
outcome.population: Intention to treat analysis was done therefore, the analysis population includes all participants who were randomized (n=19).

group.description: Real world strategy approach: The key features of the protocol are: i. Participants are actively engaged in selecting their treatment goals. Three of these will be training goals, two will not be trained but evaluated post-intervention for evidence of generalization and transfer to non-trained tasks; ii. A global problem solving approach is used (Goal- Plan- Do- Check). Participants are guided by the trainer to apply this strategy to their goals.

group.description: The active comparator uses an information-based format and is designed to engage participants without providing any specific training techniques or strategies. During weekly sessions, participants will receive factual information on brain structure and function, age-related cognitive changes, and general brain health issues and will spend time doing non-specific cognitive exercises including crossword and Sudoku puzzles. Homework will consist of reading assignments related to the session topics.

measure.title: Total Number of Goals Improved to Criterion on the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
measure.description: COPM is a standardized semi-structure interview in which participants identify goals related to everyday life activities. Goals considered improved to criterion are those that had 2 or more points increase on COPM ratings.
measure.population: Intention to treat analysis was done therefore, the analysis population includes all participants who were randomized (n=19).

analysis.p_value_desc: Statistical analysis applies to post intervention performance category
Statistical analysis applies to post intervention satisfaction category
Statistical analysis applies to 3-month follow up performance category
Statistical analysis applies to 3-month follow up satisfaction category

outcome.description: GSE is a self efficacy scale with a minimum score of 10 and a maximum score of 40. Higher scores indicate higher self efficacy

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
